SENT.plain: The authors present a case of an aneurysm of the inferior vena cava in a 5-year-old boy
The boy suffered from acute pulmonary and paradoxical cerebral embolism after a minor abdominal trauma
Magnetic resonance angiography was the key for correct diagnosis of the retroperitoneal process and helped develop a strategy for surgery
The boy underwent resection of the aneurysm and a prosthetic replacement of the distal inferior vena cava
Aneurysms of the inferior vena cava are very rare conditions
The diagnosis is difficult because they may mimic a retroperitoneal tumor
Thrombosis and embolism are common complications of aneurysms of the vena cava
